title: The Use of Social Media in Healthcare
headline: Develop an understanding of social media's role in providing better healthcare in this free online course on Alison.
description: Have you ever wondered how you can use gaming to influence healthy behaviour? Trying to understand the role that social media can play in the healthcare sector is challenging. This course explores all the possibilities where social media influences our health. Whether it's the variety of tools available for promoting health on social media or improving patient-doctor interaction, we have covered it. So enrol now!
courseDescription:
Do you want to understand the role technology and social media can play in bringing doctors and patients closer? Or are you wondering which tools to use to empower patients more about health and healthy choices? This online course on the use of social media in healthcare will guide you through the massive impact social media plays in today's healthcare industry, whether it's online doctor consultations or managing large volumes of data. First, the course introduces social media and we discuss its origin and key platforms available. We will then examine e-Health and explain how it has evolved into an instrumental communication medium between doctors and patients.

Ever wondered what the term ‘medical social media’ means? We identify the key players and stakeholders in the merger of social media and healthcare and the role it can play in patients' long-term health. Have you ever come across blogs, vlogs or podcasts related to healthcare on your social media feed? A wide variety of platforms are available on social media to share information. We will identify essential documentation that lets you communicate with doctors online and explore the content and sublanguage used in this type of medium. Having a hands-on approach to one's health is hugely empowering. We shall analyse social media's role in providing valuable social and emotional support and identify possible limitations that users can encounter.

Have you ever looked around and seen a lack of interest among the general population in their health? Public awareness and participation of people are a crucial part of health management. Ensuring that the modern-day patient is well informed and engaged is vital. The term ‘e-patient’ shall be defined and explained, along with a discussion on using cognitive-behavioural therapy to affect behaviour. With the gaming industry taking off in the last few years, there is a perception that it can harm users. However, we will discuss the potential benefits of how we can use gaming to bring about a positive impact among gamers. Finally, we will examine some ethical and legal issues faced when blending social media and healthcare. Social media plays a large role in our lives. Don't waste any more time. Enrol today and understand how social media can create an awareness of health in this technological world.
